ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I have learned so much about research and my own passion for research.
I became better at working with my peers on large projects!
I learned how to build deadlines and carry out various research skills for the senior project
This is a really helpful course that gives you guidance and camaraderie as you work through your senior thesis.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course facilitates great and thorough relationships with your peers. And ensures that clear feedback is given through out. I wish we had more time to give presentations about our work in class because everyone is doing such amazing things!
Strength - structure for thesis writing. Weakness - perhaps too much reading and abstract talking, could do with more synchronous writing time.

I think the main thing that I have mentioned is that it will be fun to engage with some texts that deal specifically with AMST as a discipline/institution and learn more about what it means to do this type of work.

Strengths: having a community to struggle through the thesis with !!! + tangible research skills readings etc.

Weaknesses: having to have a prospectus + adviser two weeks into the semester was quite a steep ask... giving an extra week or two might have helped me choose a more daring project rather than defaulting to a more readily imaginable one due to time crunch panic

My main feeling about this course is that it's generally great but that if you are doing a creative project instead of an essay, it isn't really "built" for you. The course is really geared towards students who are writing traditional research papers, which makes sense because that is the majority of students. However, if you are working on a creative project, you feel a little confused/behind/unsure of how to handle your work. I think Amstud should have either two separate courses for people working on essays and people working on projects OR they can be taught in the same course using different syllabi/timelines/deadlines.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, writing a year long thesis in the American Studies program has been exciting and rewarding!
Yes for seniors doing the two semester AMST thesis

I would recommend doing the year long American Studies thesis if you want a longer term project and community to do it with, but doing a MAP capstone project for a year as well is quite challenging ! Learn from my mistakes and be mindful of your own tolerance for independent research and workload of senior requirements
Yes, if you want to do the yearlong thesis.
